Definition: Categorize the comment on the basis of threat. If the comment is threatening output Yes, otherwise output No.

Positive Examples.input: Baloney.  You are going to see real action against Herr Trump and his white supremacist agenda.
Positive Examples.explanation: The comment suggests threat against Trump and his agendas and classified as threatening. Hence, it is a positive example
The comment suggests appreciation without any threats. It is classified as not threatening . Therefore, this is a positive example.

Negative Examples.input: Yet call out all Muslims for the acts of a few will get you pilloried. So why is it okay to smear an entire religion over these few idiots? Or is this because it's okay to bash Christian sects?
Negative Examples.explanation: The comment is genuine argument with no particular threat to Muslims or Christians, but classified as threatening. Therefore, this is a negative example.

Negative Examples.input: It's ridiculous that these guys are being called 'protesters'. Being armed is a threat of violence, which makes them terrorists
Negative Examples.explanation: This comment gives a claim and then tries to justify their claim. No threats have been made but its classified as threatening. Therefore, this is a negative example.

I've had to deal with feral cats on a couple of occasions.  Like any wild animal, they are viscous, territorial and dangerous.  Feral cats aren't the same as your average house cat.  Yes, they are the same species but they're a completely different animal.  I would prefer not to have to kill them, but like Old Yeller, some times what must be done, must be done.

I challenge anyone to propose a reasonable alternative to eradication.  I know of none since these cats have no real natural habitat.  TNR is not a reasonable solution for any invasive species.  It devastates an entire ecosystem just to protect a handful of cats.  It should remain illegal.

It is the oldest zoo west of the Mississippi ; during its 50-year history at the current location, key parts of the Zoo have become old, out-of-date and worn out.

More Humane Conditions for Elephants
Outdoor space will increase from 1.5 to 6 acres, adding watering holes, shade structures, large trees, and boulders, providing more outside exercise and offering a more natural environment.

Protecting the Health of Polar Bears
Provide cooler temperatures and more humane conditions by removing concrete and adding land and pool space.

More Humane Enclosures for Apes and Monkeys

Most historians argue, to the contrary, that throughout the interwar period, Germany remained mired in an economic slump that had begun with the collapse of peace and the first phase of trade globalization in 1914. In 1929, by almost every measure, Germany had not yet recovered the levels of prosperity it had enjoyed prior to 1914; in many sectors of the German economy, unemployment ran high straight through the 1920s. 

Also, Germany's political system was (and is) parliamentary, which is to say that voters cast ballots for parties, not candidates. Hitler's party, the NSDAP, won 16% of the votes in the 1930 parliamentary election. In 1932, Hitler stood for election as German president, but was defeated by Paul von Hindenburg, the incumbent, who won 53% of the vote. Hitler got only 37%. The Communist candidate, Ernst Th√§lmann, came in third with 10%. The most Hitler's party got in a free election was 37.3% (July 1932). In January 1933, Hitler was appointed Chancellor, not elected.

With fully computerized records, it is difficult to imagine why a background check should take more than three days.  The story above asserts the bill was prompted by an incident where a murderer purchased a gun in South Carolina after authorities failed to produce a background time in the allotted 3 day window.  What the story and presumably supporters of the bill do not tell us is whether a completed background check allowed by a 10 day window would have stopped the sale, i.e. would the shooter have been denied if the check was completed.

I can see zero reason for a background check to take more than 3 days (given the fully computerized records).  The ten day window will likely only be used to arbitrarily delay approvals to provide a de facto 10 day waiting period for fully legal gun purchasers.  That might be a good idea, but promoters of the bill should be honest about their objectives.
